entry.title: "Blackstone’s billionaire CEO Stephen Schwartzman boasted...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Blackstone’s billionaire CEO Stephen Schwartzman boasted that after the 2008 financial crisis, his firm was able to cash in on the mortgage crisis. At the time, the company was able to buy up foreclosed homes and convert them into rental properties subsequently plagued by accusations of dilapidation and excessive fees — all while it received a big financial boost from the government."
-------
Basically Blackstone is profiting off the misfortune of others with the help of gov...'t subsidies. Making mass homelessness nation wide.

No wonder they are so willing to contribute so much money to the political system that has extracted wealth (in the form of home ownership) from the people.

https://www.dailyposter.com/p/gop-megadonor-celebrates-his-…

See MoreBillionaire Blackstone CEO Steve Schwarzman bragged about his firm’s big earnings off high rents — and he boasted that his firm “was a huge winner coming out of the global financial crisis” in 2008.

dailyposter.com

GOP Megadonor Celebrates His Profits From “Huge Increases In Rents” As Millions Face Eviction

Billionaire Blackstone CEO Steve Schwarzman bragged about his firm’s big earnings off high rents — and he boasted that his firm “was a huge winner coming out of the global financial crisis” in 2008.Billionaire Blackstone CEO Steve Schwarzman bragged about his firm’s big earnings off high rents — and he boasted that his firm “was a huge winner coming out of the global financial crisis” in 2008.

entry.title: Sweeps Planned During Lawsuit Hearing Next Week, And of the...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweeps Planned During Lawsuit Hearing Next Week, And of the Encampment Across the Street from Coming SOS site on Same Day SOS Opens

There are two sweeps scheduled for next week, in spite of the city having to be at court to defend these very sweeps.

...

4th and Kalamath is scheduled to be swept during the court hearing on Tuesday December 15th.

16th and Pearl is scheduled to be swept on Thursday December 17th the same day as the SOS site is set to be opening across the street. This SOS site will have space for up to 40 people (depending on couples sharing tents - as there are 30 tents). There are at least 50 people living at the street encampment planned to be swept. Even if everyone of these people moved into the SOS site, there would be at least 10-20 that would not fit. And this is just from this one encampment - while we have at least many more encampments this size and bigger across our city.

Please come and support our unhoused community members at 4th and Kalamath on Tuesday, and 16th and Pearl on Thursday as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

Contact:

info@denverhomelessoutloud.org

720-940-5291

See More

entry.title: "When social workers visit encampments that the city plans...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"When social workers visit encampments that the city plans to clear, they try to connect people living in tents and makeshift dwellings with services like shelters, counseling and housing. "
--------
A lot of people try to do things that are unlikely. For example there are many who try to qualify for the Olympics, but only few do because the completion is so great. When they do we celebrate them.

The challenge of qualifying for housing is similar. There is not enough housin...g for all those who need it. So the competition to get into the available housing is great and few actually make it in. Yet a statement like the one above makes it seem as if it is a processing issue and not an availability issue.

The shelters are full.
The shelters are dangerous especially during Covid.

If housing was available people would be getting housed. The lack of housing is why people are on the streets in the first place.
So media typically discuss every thing except the most needed thing ACTUAL UNITS OF HOSUSING that people can live in insted of the street. It will mean things like construction of budget housing (vs what realestale lobbyiests "market rate" aka "luxury").

It will mean things like the construction of public housing.
(public housing is gov't subsidised housing.

BTW Budget housing is not gov't subsidised, and is availble on the market , one of our poblems in thehousing market is that no one builds budget housing and it is our reatest need.

Rent control etc.

All that is discussed what the service providers are doing because they are the ones that get the money instead of building or buying the units we need.

https://denverite.com/…/denver-tries-a-new-approach-at-lar…/

See MoreAs large encampments multiply in Denver, city workers conduct cleanup after cleanup that shift tent cities from one block to another, hardly a solution for either the people living on the streets o…

denverite.com

Denver tries a new approach at large encampments to help people experiencing homelessness

As large encampments multiply in Denver, city workers conduct cleanup after cleanup that shift tent cities from one block to another, hardly a solution for either the people living on the streets o…As large encampments multiply in Denver, city workers conduct cleanup after cleanup that shift tent cities from one block to another, hardly a solution for either the people living on the streets o…

entry.title: In mere month craming people together into a building has led to...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

In mere month craming people together into a building has led to an outbreak.

https://www.9news.com/…/73-419c710b-2c40-4945-8dbe-a7b4ca10…

The positive tests were among both guests and staff members at the shelter.

9news.com

54 people test positive for COVID-19 at Fort Collins temporary homeless shelter

The positive tests were among both guests and staff members at the shelter.The positive tests were among both guests and staff members at the shelter.

entry.title: Hearing for Injunction to Stop Sweeps Is Coming!! Dec 15th and...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Hearing for Injunction to Stop Sweeps Is Coming!! Dec 15th and 16th

CALL FOR SUPPORT!!

★ Donate funds to put up our houseless witnesses in hotel rooms the night before each day of the hearing! We have 3 houseless witnesses and we want to ensure they have a safe space for those three nights. We are trying to raise about $700 for all these individual’s hotels for the time of the hearing. You can donate via Pay Pal here https://www.paypal.com/donate/…

...Continue Reading

entry.title: Today the area encompassing 20th, 21st, 22nd, Market, Blake, and...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Today the area encompassing 20th, 21st, 22nd, Market, Blake, and Wazee was SWEPT. Many of these residents moved to this area after the Arkins SWEEP. There were approximately 75+ people living there. One woman was tied down to a stretcher and taken by ambulance clearly against her consent. Then all of her belongings were trashed. One resident had her tents trashed while she was moving some of her belongings to the fence line as community volunteers are still being denied entry... into the fenced area. While volunteers and advocates were busy providing food, drink, supplies, and moving folks from 20th, 21st, Market and Blake, one man stood alone against 7 officers on 22nd and Wazee. Eventually, he was forced to move. Advocates arrived to witness the last tent which was unoccupied being trashed by DOTI.

And the City just keeps on SWEEPING. Tomorrow a SWEEP is posted for 7th and Lincoln. Another SWEEP is posted for Tuesday December 15, 2020 at 4th and Kalamath, the same day as our court hearing.

This insanity must stop!

Wanna get involved? Tomorrow DDPHE will have a public comment session. DDPHE is the Denver Department of Public Health one of the lead agencies in conducting SWEEPS. These are the guys who declare a public site as hazardous. Sign up at: https://www.denvergov.org/…/boa…/general-public-comment.html

See More

entry.title: THREE Sweeps This Week - Pushing the Same People Block to...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

THREE Sweeps This Week - Pushing the Same People Block to Block...

THREE sweeps are scheduled for next week. The City is clearly trying to get as many sweeps as possible in before our lawsuit hearing the following week.

13th and Elati is also posted for a sweep next Tuesday, December 8th. This camp has roughly 50 people and is about half made up of people who moved there from the downtown library sweep a couple weeks ago.

...

21st,20th, Market, Blake and Wazee from 22nd to Park Ave is scheduled for Wednesday, December 9th. This encampment made up of people who were swept from 22nd and Wazze a couple weeks ago and from Arkins this week. Now the City plans to sweep them again...to some other block to be swept again...

7th and Lincoln is scheduled for a sweep on Thursday December 10th. This encampment moved one block from the other side of 7 news a few weeks ago after a sweep.

Please come and support our unhoused community members at 13th and Elati on Tuesday, 21st and Market and Blake on Wednesday, and 7th and Lincoln on Thursday as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…
Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

See More

entry.title: Only took 10 months... to get permission. To put tents in neat...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Only took 10 months... to get permission.
To put tents in neat rows socially distanced rows
with a couple of port-a-potty.

Hope the city doe not call the port-a-potty company to remove then like they do with ones at unsanctioned camps. Those port-a-potties meet the same health need in either case.

...

We need about 50 of these to meet the need and after nerly a year we have 1.

https://denverite.com/…/denvers-first-temporary-sanctione…/…

See MoreThe safe outdoor space in the First Baptist Church parking lot in Capitol Hill will have 22 tents and accommodate a maximum of 30 women and transgender people

denverite.com

Denver’s first temporary sanctioned camp for people experiencing homelessness is set to open Dec. 7

entry.title: "If you’re going to make decisions, and make decisions...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"If you’re going to make decisions, and make decisions that are against public-health guidance, you’re going to have to answer for those decisions," McNulty says

McNulty doesn't buy it. "I find it hypocritical that Hancock is using the pandemic as some sort of shield to testify, when just two weeks ago he was flying across the country for Thanksgiving," he says.
----------

...

The same mayor who is to busy to see the federal Judge on the sweeps case
during business hours with a job he can delegate day to day stuff to.. has plenty of thine to fly out of state to visit family when he tell everyone else to stay put. Time to face the Music nasty man. Perhaps he is so use to lying that he knows he will lie in front of the Judge and that would lead to serous consequences. Like contempt of court charges. We already know the Judge is not happy with the cities attitude in this case as the Judge stated during testimony in the Lyall vs Denver case. You are not going to be able to order around the Federal Judge the way you do the city attorney.

https://www.westword.com/…/colorado-governor-denver-mayor-t…

See MoreThe case has a hearing this month.

westword.com

Hancock, Polis Try to Avoid Testifying in Homeless-Sweeps Lawsuit

The case has a hearing this month.The case has a hearing this month.

entry.title: THE WOMEN'S VILLAGE @ CLARA BROWN COMMONS IS OPEN!!!
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

THE WOMEN'S VILLAGE @ CLARA BROWN COMMONS IS OPEN!!!

+2Colorado Village Collaborative

THE WOMEN'S VILLAGE @ CLARA BROWN COMMONS IS OPEN!!!

Yesterday, the first residents spent the night in this brand new cluster of 14 tiny homes, which make up De...nver's second tiny home village. One resident reported spending the previous night in a stairwell. Another resident reported spending the previous night in an abandoned warehouse.

Now these women are held in the warmth, security, and stability of shelter and community. On this new morning, the process of healing from past traumas begins.

Since passing zoning code changes in October 2019 that made room for Temporary Tiny Home Villages all throughout the city, the number of tiny homes in Denver has tripled from 11 units to 33 units in just one year.

Today we celebrate! Tomorrow we move forward to realize our collective goal of shelter, community, stability, health, and housing for all.

See More
